Column Comment.0: CREW COMPANY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thecompany that runs this crew. Not all members of a crew may be employees, but maybe contractors or seconded to the crew by another company.
Column Comment.1: CREW IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the crew.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: COST PER UNIT: The cost per unit for this crew member in this position. Usuallycost per hour, but in some cases could be cost per day.
Column Comment.4: COST PER UNIT CURRENCY UNIT OF MEASURE UOM: the currency in which thecost is measure.
Column Comment.5: COST PER UNIT UNIT OF MEASURE: Usually hour or day.
Column Comment.6: CREW ABBREVIATION: Usually a reference number or code that identifies the crew.
Column Comment.7: CREW LONG NAME: full name for the crew.
Column Comment.8: CREW SHORT NAME: short name for the crew.
Column Comment.9: CREW TYPE: A list of valid kinds of crews, such as drilling crews, cleanup crews,inspection crews, logging crews or seismic crews.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
